remarks: The function ` F ` enumerates all equivalence classes in ` Z/nZ ` for each ` n ` .  When ` n = 0 ` , ` ZZ / 0 ZZ = ZZ / { 0 } ~~ ZZ ` so we let ` W = ZZ ` ; otherwise ` W = { 0 , ... , n - 1 } ` enumerates all the equivalence classes.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Jun-2015.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 2-May-2016.)  (Revised by AV, 13-Jun-2019.)
statement:
znf1o.y $e |- Y = ( Z/nZ ` N ) $.
znf1o.b $e |- B = ( Base ` Y ) $.
znf1o.f $e |- F = ( ( ZRHom ` Y ) |` W ) $.
znf1o.w $e |- W = if ( N = 0 , ZZ , ( 0 ..^ N ) ) $.
znf1o $p |- ( N e. NN0 -> F : W -1-1-onto-> B ) $.
